She will go ahead, and is mortal enough to find it from the other side. It's the sure way."
TEXT.Spanish: [LINK=LORE_BRIGHT_LAND_1]Part 1: In a Bright Land[\LINK][NEWLINE]Part 2: In a Bright Land[NEWLINE][LINK=LORE_BRIGHT_LAND_3]Part 3: In a Bright Land[\LINK][NEWLINE][LINK=LORE_BRIGHT_LAND_4]Part 4: In a Bright Land[\LINK][PARAGRAPH:2]In a bright land, in a white city, in a dark room a great emperor sits on his gold throne, plotting. He can feel his adopted people, alive in any significant sense, thriving and free on the face of Erebus. The barbarians to the south and east would fall soon enough, and emissaries were on their way from the "nations" to the north. They would be dealt with. And then west, to the sea, and [BOLD]through[\BOLD] the Sidar. Fools.[PARAGRAPH:1]The silent ones thought they revered Arawn. All they really worship is their idea of that dark god. Not only is he different from what they imagine, he might be more different than they can imagine. God of the Underworld, yes, but only warden of the Dreamlands. What is a god who cedes power and authority at every chance? Who's own chosen realm is a riot of freedom, rotting around him? Life, and Death. Absolute freedom and complete confinement. God of beginnings and endings. Neither light nor dark. The Gray One.[PARAGRAPH:1]He remembered the passage of that oppressive aura, and pressing himself tight against the dark stone. Fear spikes through him and he shifts on his throne. His bodyguards, circling the chamber, stir in turn, every woman's weapon glinting red and silver.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Sidar were right about his color, at least. Brighter than the night, but infinitely deeper. Gray. The emperor shudders, as if bitten by the cold he can never feel. The Hidden Queen had her secrets, but they could be revealed. The Gray One might be unknowable.[PARAGRAPH:1]ITALICS]"I know who you are, though you do not."[\ITALICS][PARAGRAPH:1]Her. How could she be his spawn? Sure compassion... and her brother raging anger. Maybe the twins were just the knowable portions of the God, exiled into the deciphered world.[PARAGRAPH:1]He knew his thoughts went in circles. They always did when he thought of his most successful mission. His Lord had never cloaked him better. Yet it hadn't been enough. Thinking was not the way through. The eyes of memory can never see aright in the dreamlands, only the eyes of dreams.[PARAGRAPH:1]Lights scattered over her black mantle like the stars, and following her through the twisting passages was like spinning up into a night sky that had suddenly abandoned Erebus for the void. Disoriented and lost beyond recovery should she betray him, Rahserat, the fallen Angel of Good Intentions, could only endure as the Hidden Queen guided him down the paths only she knew.[PARAGRAPH:1]Finally she halted by a doorway formed of three large bluestones, the horizontal one marked with an eye and a hand. "This is the one," she whispered. "Give me the password."[PARAGRAPH:1]"My Lord bade me tell you only after I stood safe and free within the Underworld."[PARAGRAPH:1]"This is the one. The Death God will know if I enter his realm. Give me the password."[PARAGRAPH:1]"I'm sorry, my lady, but I carry my Lord's trust."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Don't mock me, Rahserat."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Never. But I have been given this," Rahserat produced a small yellow vial. "I will destroy it when I stand in Arawn's kingdom. The knowledge you want to be released to you then."[PARAGRAPH:1]"So." Her whisper was so soft he had to lean forward to catch her words. "And if you do not I will consider your Lord, and you, to have betrayed me."[PARAGRAPH:1]The angel said nothing. He'd been warned against speaking to her more than was absolutely necessary. He merely bowed. She hissed, and gestured at the doorway. He stepped through it.[PARAGRAPH:1]After that it was hard to put things in chronological order. Later he wondered if his own realm drove the Death God insane. Where a human found infinite freedom, bounded only by his own mind and preconceptions, what would the unbounded mind of a god find? It was hard enough being an angel.[PARAGRAPH:1]But he did his master's bidding, working for the downfall of the One and a better world beyond.[PARAGRAPH:1]First he used the vial. Then, cloaked as one of the angels appropriate to this place, Rahserat moved through the dreamlands. He persuaded, he tempted, he cajoled. He ministered to the souls, always playing off their better nature and always guiding them back toward ambition. This kingdom of the most uncaring god was naturally a place of stillness, where the unguided dead lost themselves. And though he did not specifically direct their re-awakened ambitions - that could too easily invite scrutiny - he knew where striving would necessarily lead them: The new center of the dreamlands, the anti-deity Laroth. That Spirit master collected the newly aware dead into an army. An army to challenge the reigning Death God. Even if Laroth was doomed, his plotting weakened Arawn's hold over the underworld and especially his angels. If the grandiose plan succeeded Rahserat didn't know if Laroth would be any better an ally for his Lord than the Hidden Queen. But it would remove a god who stood with the One.[PARAGRAPH:1]Rahserat avoided the Forsaken Palace, Arawn's seldom-occupied center of power. Yet as he moved among that god's angels some show of participating in their increasingly disorganized and apathetically pursued work had to be maintained. Thus at times he walked the basalt and chalk halls, trapped for days, sometimes longer, in elaborate games of etiquette and influence. The dead-eyed black-and-white patterned angels that formed the palace guard and inner-administration, called phantoms, were unwaveringly loyal to the Grey One. Every other angel was suspect. Rahserat had to play a careful game both with those of certain loyalty and with those who might be Laroth's minions. But his Lord's cloak, his assumed identity, always held. Or, really, lack of identity. He started thinking of himself as the Other Angel. Never Rahserat. Never the angel he spoke to, or one that angel had just seen or spoken with. Always someone else. The Other Angel.[PARAGRAPH:1]Even when he escaped the Palace a feeling of self-alienation didn't leave him. Mirrors began haunting him. Usually empty, but sometimes they showed Laroth. Even Basium, whose thundering could sometimes be heard throughout the underworld, at least by an angel, would be clever enough to understand. What did Rahserat do so differently from Laroth? Both twisted the spirit or soul out of true, both always using something within the spirit or soul to do so. Laroth did so for personal gain, while Rahserat helped topple empires for his Lord, and thus for all of creation. But still the mirrors haunted. Rather than spinning a dream he could inhabit Rahserat felt he was unraveling himself, weaving a new Rahserat. One who took souls supposedly safe within the underworld and drove them on. Hell, the great machine that was Agares' greatest triumph, now reached here. Thanks to Rahserat. It was better than utter destruction, but the world would pay a great price to withstand the One.[PARAGRAPH:1]Even with angelic memory he couldn't know when it happened, on which sortie into the Palace it occurred. But while transversing a black stone gallery above the entrance hall Rahserat felt the arrival of the Death God. There was a pull, or a calling. Maybe it was what mortality felt like? But it was irresistible, and all eyes went to the Twilight Portal.[PARAGRAPH:1]A guard of phantoms assembled along the wide, descending stairway from the great doors. Their black and white ribbons hung limp, stirring only when they turned, as one, to face the Portal. Two were already by the doors and pulling on the great rings, swinging wide the doors and revealing the Grey One.[PARAGRAPH:1]Stern and aloof, he loomed in the open doorway like a thundercloud. Fine clothes, with both tunic and pants of a rich, thick cloth. But everything only in shades of grey. Pale silver from the lining and jet rings on the hands were the only adornments. And, like a cloud, he dimmed light in his presence. The phantoms at the doors prostrated themselves. Uncaring, the Death God passed them and descended the stairway. Each phantom going to one knee as he strode by. A wave of ribbons in absolute hues fooled the eye, blending and seeming still even as they rippled with the sudden motion. So flanked by motionless movement, by black and white mixed to grey, by the bowed heads of servants utterly loyal and completely unacknowledged, Arawn entered his palace.[PARAGRAPH:1]Rahserat should have fled when he first felt the god. He had no wish to test his masks against the Grey One himself. But Arawn could never be avoided indefinitely. And Arawn was already walking up the gallery.[PARAGRAPH:1]The illicit angel pressed himself into an alcove carved directly from the basalt. Fighting an urge to run Rahserat went to his knees, bowing toward the walkway, and then went still. The footsteps of the Death God and his retinue were the only sounds, and they were coming closer. Then they were before him, and died away. Hearing nothing, knowing Arawn stood before him, Rahserat looked up.[PARAGRAPH:1][ITALICS]"Who are [BOLD]you?[\BOLD]"[\ITALICS][PARAGRAPH:1]Suddenly unable to see, the god's demand hit Rahserat like a hammer blow. Was this how Iaegus fell? The angel felt like he might be crushed, caught between the god's pull and the need to escape. He choked back a damning response and concentrated on his Lord's precept.[PARAGRAPH:1]When Arawn turned his head Rahserat could see again. The god spoke to someone beside him.[PARAGRAPH:1][ITALICS]"It hardly matters. Give him to your brother. Whatever's necessary should be done."[\ITALICS][PARAGRAPH:1]"Yes, Arawn. I will see to what's needed."[PARAGRAPH:1]The god walked on, leaving Rahserat with an angel of female aspect. Pale, with long hair utterly black, and wearing pure white. She looked after the god until that one, never glancing back or even to the side, had turned a corner. Then she beckoned Rahserat with a gesture. "Stand."[PARAGRAPH:1]No, she wasn't an angel. She possessed too strong an aura. An archangel.[PARAGRAPH:1]A pair of phantoms waited at her side, one with a spear and one with chains. "You may go. This one is no threat to me. You," she gestured to Rahserat again. "You will come with me."[PARAGRAPH:1]The phantoms followed their god, and Gyra suddenly took Rahserat's face in her hands, seizing him with her eyes. "I will not give you to my brother. I will not even see you driven from this place. For you have work to do."[PARAGRAPH:1]Her eyes blazed, lit by something Rahserat thought he'd seen before, but had long since forgotten. "You see, little angel, [ITALICS]I know who you are, though you do not."[\ITALICS][PARAGRAPH:1]Gyra took him from the Forsaken Palace and to her own places on the edge of the underworld. She showed him many things. Though it was properly in the keeping of her brother, she showed him an unguarded and secret way into Erebus: The Ivory Gate. She showed him better ways to bend others to his will. She could wield compassion like a knife, a knife she gave to him. She took him into her home and introduced him to her daughter, and he though she said nothing he thought he saw a father beyond the daughter: A one-handed man with stars for eyes.[PARAGRAPH:1]And never did she remonstrate with him for his deceptions, for sending more souls on to fallen Spirit master, one who he knew she worked to stop. All of this surprised him. Especially the daughter, Korinna. But nothing shocked him like the false Laroth.[PARAGRAPH:1]They stood on a cliff somehow high above the dreamlands. "Arawn made this place, to more easily survey his domain. My brother cares for other things and never came here, and Arawn comes here seldom now. But still, we shouldn't linger. I have something to show you, then a place for us to go. Come and see."[PARAGRAPH:1]He stepped to the edge and looked where she pointed. "There," she said. "Use your eyes, angel, and look upon the false new kingdom!"[PARAGRAPH:1]It was subtle, but a part of the dreamland, the inhabited underworld, seemed organized. It flowed like the rest, but some dreams stayed apart, mixing only among each other. Reading the flow for pattern, Rahserat looked for that pattern's source. There  a center. A huge hall, like an ivory vault. Mortals of all sorts at its walls and in the center a man with a mirrored crown. The would-be god, Laroth.[PARAGRAPH:1]Gyra touched his shoulder and Rahserat's gaze was torn from the distance. Then the archangel's pointing finger commanded his attention in a new direction. There he spied another seed of order within the dreamland's chaos. Another pattern. This one was smaller, and even more subtle. Furtive might have been a better word. At its center another hall, empty this time. But there was another throne. And on this throne..."[PARAGRAPH:1]"You look upon the new false kingdom, Rahserat. TEXT.English: Former inhabitants of the Bottomless Tomb, the Awakened issue forth at their own pleasure.[PARAGRAPH:1]Use to found new cities, or add to an existing city's population.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Gift is eternal as the Emperor's glory, but even the pull of his call cannot reverberate forever in the Tomb's infinite gray. The passing of each day means more of the Awakened dead of Patria fall back to slumber. However, increased industry and devotion in Patria Reborn can coax the honored dead from their rest. As can the availability of favored luxuries in the cities. Furthermore a thriving, populous capital, the embrace of the Awakened as Aristocracy, and every Shrine to Kylorin, Temple of the Gift, Imperial Cenotaph, Hall of the Covenant, or source of Patrian artifacts serves to strengthen the Emperor's Will and call more of our people back to the world.[PARAGRAPH:1]Alternatively a series of bridges into the Tomb allows members of the Apparat to retrieve some of the Awakened. Such structures are expensive, however, and the inevitable animation of each as it accepts the Gift means each can be used only for a short time.
TEXT.French: Anciens habitants de la Tombe Sans Fin, les Éveillés en sortent selon leur bon vouloir.[PARAGRAPH:1]Utilisez-les pour fonder de nouvelles villes ou pour augmenter la population d'une ville existante.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le Don est éternel, de même que la gloire de l'Empereur, mais même la force de son appel ne peut pas se réverbérer à tout jamais dans le gris infini de la Tombe. Chaque jour qui passe signifie que plus de morts Éveillés de Patria retournent au sommeil éternel. Cependant, une production et une dévotion accrue dans Patria Ressuscitée peut attirer les morts honorés hors de leur sommeil. De même que l'accès aux ressources luxueuses dans les villes. Par ailleurs, une capitale florissante et peuplée, l'adoption de l'Aristocratie, et chaque Autel de Kylorin, Temple du Don, Cénotaphe Impérial, Hall du Pacte, ou source d'Artefacts Patriens permettent de renforcer la Volonté de l'Empereur et rappelle plus d'entre nous vers ce monde.[PARAGRAPH:1]Sinon, une série de ponts dans la Tombe permet aux membres de l'Apparat de récupérer quelques uns des Éveillés. De telles structures sont cependant onéreuses, et leur animation une fois que chaque pont accepte le Don signifie qu'ils ne peuvent être utilisés que pendant un court laps de temps.

TEXT.English: Centeni are Age of Rebirth warriors employed by the Scions. Made up mostly of fighters from small, scattered tribes the "barbarian" soldiers of the Centeni are grateful to the Risen Emperor for the shelter, food and protection he provides. They're especially attracted to the small wonders of Patrian Artifacts.[PARAGRAPH:1]Centeni smear their faces with ashes to show their alligence. Still, they are usually poorly organized and equipped. Extra enducements may be required to keep up their fighting strength.[PARAGRAPH:1]The best of the Centeni are granted the Gift and made full Scions of Patria. These units are fanatical defenders of the Emperor.[PARAGRAPH:1]Warriors may gain instant elevation by agreeing to adopt the way of the Honored Band.

TEXT.English: The Centeni is the Scions' Warrior UU. It is one of the very few Scion units who are not undead, and it generally represents a small band of hired mercenaries. Centeni are mostly similar to Warriors, but they have two key differences. Firstly, they have the Unreliable promotion. This gives them a 10% strength penalty, and thusly makes them weaker than warriors. However, they also have the Extra Pay ability. This costs 1 gold to use, and grants them a 15% strength bonus for 1 turn. While under the effect of Extra pay, they are ever so slightly stronger than normal warriors. But the fact that they require money to do that, even if only a small amount, makes them generally inferior to warriors. One good use for them however, being the Scions only Living unit, is to cast Mutate on them, then upgrade them into other, more useful things. Since mutate does not work on the undead, this is the only way to get mutated units as Scions.

TEXT.English: The Scions prefer skirmishers to hunters. A Cetratus will often defend more powerful units, keeping them fresh for battle and, hopefully, withdrawing to fight another day.
TEXT.French: Les Scions préfèrent les tirailleurs aux chasseurs. Un Cetratus défendra souvent des unités plus puissantes, les gardant fraiches pour le combat et, avec un peu de chance, faisant retraite pour combattre un autre jour.

TEXT.English: The most obvious symbol of his power, a Doomgiver's Seeing Sword has grown. Its eye fully open, its blade well fanged.[PARAGRAPH:1]A Doomgiver manipulates fate almost contemptuously. Their most vulnerable foes will find themselves seeking shelter where the Doomgiver already waits. A Doomgiver can shatter the destiny of an entire city, or make it a place angel's envy.
TEXT.French: Symbole le plus évident de son pouvoir, l'Épée de Vision d'un Exécuteur de la Damnation a grandi. Son oeil est totalement ouvert, et sa lame acérée.[PARAGRAPH:1]Un Exécuteur de la Damnation, manipule presque le destin avec mépris. Leurs ennemis les plus vulnérables se retrouveront à chercher un refuge là où l'Exécuteur de la Damnation les attend déjà. Un Exécuteur de la Damnation peut briser le futur d'une ville entière, ou en faire un lieu qu'envierait un ange.

TEXT.English: A Doomgiver can recruit people for your cities and their attacks not only destroy the opposing unit, but reduce the population of the city defended. Set to rule, a Doomgiver strengthens the Scion's hold over a city.
TEXT.French: Un Exécuteur de la Damnation peut recruter des habitants pour vos villes. De plus, leurs attaques ne détruisent pas uniquement l'unité adverse, mais réduit également la population de la ville qu'elle défendait. Né pour régner, un Exécuteur de la Damantion renforce l'emprise des scions sur une ville.
TEXT.German: Ein Verhängnisbringer kann für Eure Städte Leute rekrutieren, und seine Attacken vernichten nicht nur die gegnerische Einheit, sondern reduzieren auch die Stadtbevölkerung. Ein Verhängnisbringer stärkt den scionischen Einfluss über eine Stadt.

TEXT.English: Priests of either the Emperor's Cult or Patria's Destiny.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Scion's worship revolves around reverence for the Patrian culture, Patrian history, and the Scions' divine destiny. Doomsayers hold that this destiny is immutable and borrow its power to alter lines of fate. They possess few obvious magics, but to oppose a Doomsayer is to find the very weft and warp of the world turning against you.[PARAGRAPH:1]Near a Doomsayer it's easy to find yourself humming a hymn to the Risen Emperor you didn't even know. The world *bends* where Doomsayers walk, and it bends toward Patria Reborn. Doomsayers prefer to bring opponents into the fold rather than kill them. (Well, techinically, one follows the other.)
TEXT.French: Ce sont des prêtres soit du Culte de l'Empereur, soit de la Destinée de Patria.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le culte des scions s'articule principalement autour de la culture Patricienne, l'histoire Patricienne, et la destinée divine des scions. Les Prophètes de la Damnation soutiennent que cette destinée est immuable et empruntent ses pouvoirs pour altérer les lignes du destin. Ils possèdent peu de pouvoirs magiques visibles, mais s'opposer à eux c'est découvrir que la trame du monde se retourne contre soi.[PARAGRAPH:1]À proximité d'un Prophète de la Damnation, il est facile de se retrouver à entonner un hymne à l'Empereur Ressuscité que l'on ne connaissait même pas. Le monde ploie là où marchent les Prophètes de la Damnation, et il ploie vers Patria Ressuscitée. Les Prophètes de la Damnation préfèrent ramener leurs opposants dans les rangs plutôt que de les tuer (enfin, techniquement, l'un suit l'autre).

TEXT.English: Instruments of the Imperial Apparatus, Daggers seek out and destroy threats the the Emperor.[PARAGRAPH:1]Fanatically loyal to the Emperor's person, the Apparatus has little tolerance for the Imperial Thaumaturge' madness. Daggers receive special training in the destruction of mages. They are also given a secret Writ allowing the pursuit and assassination of Alcinus whereever he may be found, with enough gold to buy blindness on the part of his new allies.
TEXT.French: Instruments des Renseignements Impériaux, les Lames dénichent et éliminent les menaces pesant sur l'Empereur.[PARAGRAPH:1]Fanatiquement loyaux à l'Empereur, les Renseignements n'ont que peu de patience face à la folie des Thaumaturges Impériaux. Les Lames recoivent un entraînement spécialisé dans la destruction des mages. Ils recoivent également une autorisation spéciale leur permettant de poursuivre et assassiner Alcinus où qu'il se trouve, avec suffisamment d'argent pour rendre aveugle ses nouveaux alliés.

TEXT.English: Sometimes a Cetratus or Velite will abandon his unit, and sometimes a Ghostwalker returns.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ghostwalkers have a special relationship with the Gift. Short of Redactors, no other Scion knows more about it. Or perhaps they know more than even Redactors... none are more influenced and changed by the Gift than Ghostwalkers.[PARAGRAPH:1]With Necromancy Ghostwalkers may spread the Haunted Lands, cultivating the strange plant known as Reaching Creeper.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ghostwalkers are profoundly a part of the Haunted Lands. So much so that Creepers are found whereever a Ghostwalker is slain, and within the Haunted Lands a Ghostwalker's shed blood alone is sometimes brings forth a Creeper. Listen carefully and you can hear them wail in the Ghostwalker's voice.
TEXT.French: Parfois un Cetratus ou un Vélite quitte son unité, et parfois un Marcheur Fantomatique revient. [PARAGRAPH:1]Les Marcheurs Fantomatiques ont un lien particulier avec le Don. Hormis les Scribes, nul autre Scion n'en sait plus sur eux. Ou peut-être en savent-ils plus que les Scribes eux-mêmes... Nul n'est plus influencé et modifié par le Don que les Marcheurs Fantomatiques.[PARAGRAPH:1]Avec la [LINK=TECH_NECROMANCY]Nécromancie[\LINK], les Marcheurs Fantomatiques deviennent capables de propager les Terres Hantées, en cultivant la plante étrange connue sous le nom de [LINK=UNIT_CREEPER]Ronce Insidieuse[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]Les Marcheurs Fantomatiques sont profondément liés aux Terres Hantées. À tel point que les Ronces sont présentes partout où un Marcheur Fantomatique est vaincu, et avec [LINK=TECH_FERAL_BOND]Lien Sauvage[\LINK] le seul sang d'un Marcheur Fantomatique peut faire germer une Ronce dont la floraison entraîne une large expansion des Terres Hantées. Écoutez attentivement, et vous les entendrez gémir dans la voix du Marcheur Fantomatique.

So much so that with Feral Bond a Ghostwalker's blood alone is enough to allow a Creeper to blossom into a wide expanse of Haunted Land. Listen carefully and you can hear them wail in the Ghostwalker's voice.

TEXT.English: Within the Haunted Lands a Ghostwalker may chose to temporarily become a Haunt.[PARAGRAPH:1]As a Haunt the Ghostwalker has great speed and greater withdrawl odds. Furthermore, while a Haunt is too insubstantial to completely destroy an enemy unit, a Haunt is fast - and vicious - enough to damage several enemy units at once.
TEXT.French: Au sein des Terres Hantées, un Marcheur Fantomatique peut choisir de devenir temporairement une [LINK=UNIT_HAUNT]Apparition[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]En tant qu'Apparition, le Marcheur Fantomaique est très mobile et dispose de meilleures chances de repli. De plus, bien qu'une Apparition soit trop inconsistante pour complètement détruire une unité ennemie, elle est assez rapide (et vicieuse) pour blesser plusieurs unités d'un coup.
TEXT.German: Innerhald der Heimgesuchten Lande kann ein Geistwanderer sich dafür entscheiden, kurzzeitig eine Heimsuchung werden.[PARAGRAPH:1]As a Haunt the Ghostwalker has great speed and greater withdrawl odds. Furthermore, while a Haunt is too insubstantial to completely destroy an enemy unit, a Haunt is fast - and vicious - enough to damage several enemy units at once.

TEXT.English: "When zero opened his mouth to shout, I am what he cried."
TEXT.French: "Quand zéro ouvrit laa bouche pour crier, Je suis ce qu'il sanglota."
TEXT.German: "When zero opened his mouth to shout, I am what he cried."
TEXT.Italian: "When zero opened his mouth to shout, I am what he cried."
TEXT.Spanish: "When zero opened his mouth to shout, I am what he cried."

TEXT.English: "Your captain holds your eyes, you just hold your line!"[PARAGRAPH:1]The Awakened are still vulnerable to blows to the head, and to a certain extent damage to the vitals. Members of the Honored Band have submitted to the removal of these things for the greater glory of Patria Reborn. The Honored Band will be glad to sacrifice everything remaining at the Emperor's command.[PARAGRAPH:1]After the body has been destroyed by the enemy a Band member's head and viscera are sealed into a jar of Emperor's Blessing from the Imperial Spirit Mill. Inside the jar an eternity of drugged rapture may be enjoyed.[PARAGRAPH:1]Recruits to the Band expect a sizable enlistment bonus - a gold ingot "receipt" for their removed head and organs.
TEXT.French: "Votre capitaine protège vos yeux, vous, tenez la ligne !"[PARAGRAPH:1]Les Éveillés restent vulnérables aux chocs à la tête, et dans une certaine mesure aux dégâts aux organes vitaux. Les membres de la Troupe d'Honneur se sont fait enlever ces éléments pour la plus grande gloire de Patria Ressuscitée. La Troupe d'Hommeur sera heureuse de sacrifier tout ce qui lui reste sur ordre de l'Empereur.[PARAGRAPH:1]Une fois que le corps a été détruit par l'ennemi, la tête et les viscères du membre de la Troupe sont scellés dans une urne de la Bénédiction de l'Empereur de l'Usine Spirituelle Impériale. À l'intérieur de l'urne les attendrait une éternité de ravissement sous drogue.[PARAGRAPH:1]Les recrues de la Troupe s'attendent à une grosse prime d'engagement, un lingot d'or en "prime" pour le retrait de leurs tête et organes.

TEXT.English: Good news! The Lady of Knives has accepted the Gift! At long last she is fully a Scion of Patria. She is Reborn among the Necromancers - the energies of her own death slew a hundred outlanders! But petty magics are not for her - the Black Lady stalks unseen! Praise the Emperor.

TEXT.English: Immortal guardian of the Second Vault, Korinna was waiting at the Emperor's side when the first Scions emerged. She is bound to the vault by a powerful geas and may not leave the capital. The Emperor's mages work to defeat the geas and release the Lady! Praise the Emperor![PARAGRAPH:1]Korrina has difficulty existing beyond the palace Wards. With Knowlege of the Ether this disability can be overcome.

Praise the Emperor![PARAGRAPH:1]Korrina has difficulty existing beyond the palace Wards. With Knowlege of the Ether this disability can be overcome.

TEXT.English: Good news! The Emperor has transformed the beloved Lady. He has made her stronger, and made us safer! She now fights among the warriors on the front - her strength a terror and inspiration, her skin a blood-red stone. The Red Lady is with us! Praise the Emperor!

TEXT.English: The Lady of Knives lives, but has been granted an everlasting existence at the whim of the Risen Emperor. What does that mean? It means blood, it means war, it means death.[PARAGRAPH:1]With "Fanatacism" the Red Lady gains "Undying."

TEXT.English: "Kill them all, we will take our own."[PARAGRAPH:1]Legates, like the higher priests, don't scar or alter themsleves to become more frightening. The Power they represent is frightening enough. Legates seek to recruit rather than destroy whenever possible. Recruitment chance is increased by the Legate's level.
TEXT.French: "Tuez les tous, nous prendrons les nôtres."[PARAGRAPH:1]Les Légats, à l'instar des hauts-prêtres, ne se scarifient pas ou ne se modifient pas pour paraître plus effrayants. Le Pouvoir qu'ils représentent est suffisamment effrayant en soi. Les Légats cherchent à recruter plutôt que de détruire dès que possible.

TEXT.English: "Is she here?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"No, Gallun, not yet... have you nothing else to say to your wife?"[PARAGRAPH:1]Gallun looked at Caracylna. She was easily even more beautiful than the day he'd met her, long ago and in another Age. He had been a solider and she a noble's daughter kidnapped by marauders. He'd rescued her, and won her hand by... Gallun let the memory slip away. He wasn't even sure if it was true, or a dream. It was so long ago and on the other side of death. The Priests said such things, if not true, were portents of greatness to come. Perhaps. Gallun wrenched himself back to the present.[PARAGRAPH:1]"No, Caracylna, I don't. How's, who is it... Ferrauth?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"He's well. Caralun never liked him, so he's absented himself. A race at the river."[PARAGRAPH:1]The conversation petered out, has all had for the last hundred years. They'd had fun together, Gallun thought, on both sides of the Gift. Scions didn't say "Nothing lasts forever," anymore, it being blasphemy. But not everything lasted forever.[PARAGRAPH:1]They waited in companionable silence for their daughter.[PARAGRAPH:1]When Caralun came she was preceded by a sudden wave of silence, then an excited whisper, and then another silence... but not like the one before. You knew it hid more whispers.[PARAGRAPH:1]Caralun stepped around the corner and the silence entered Caracylna's street as everyone stopped and stared. It was Lady Korinna! Thus, the excitement. Or, wait. No, it was not Korinna.[PARAGRAPH:1]Caralun was dressed all in black, hair dyed the same shade and a naked blade in her hand. The Studio had altered the bones of her face and figure to resemble the Protector. But this was Caralun's neighborhood. It noticed the eyes, the height. Not Korinna, but someone devoted to the great Lady's example. Someone willing to give all she could for the Emperor. A Martyr. At first it seemed as if Lady Korinna visited them. The Lady often walked the streets of the capital now, dispensing her wisdom, gifts, but most of all her presence. A visit from the Lady presaged luck and success. Happiness and security.[PARAGRAPH:1]But a Martyr conjured different things. A Martyr conjured other things entirely. Death was barred from the city, but the Martyrs of Patria would go seek him out. Some returned, usually in pieces, and so retired to cask or a Metro Arcanus. But most did not, and would not be remade till the end of the Age. By the time they saw their daughter again neither Gallun or Caracylna might remember her. Caracylna drank Emmerlane, for tears-in-joy, and embraced her daughter.[PARAGRAPH:1]"You look fine! You look wonderful, the Lady has nothing on you! I am proud, I tell you, I am so proud!"[PARAGRAPH:1]Gallun did his best to smile. He embraced his daughter, "Caralun, my Caralun."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Father, say you're proud too."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Of course I am!"[PARAGRAPH:1]"I knew you would be! Lady Korinna gave me this sword! The Emperor has blessed it! Isn't that wonderful! I knew has soon as I saw Him that this would be the finest thing I could do, the finest thing I could be!"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Yes, daughter..."[PARAGRAPH:1]"But oh, father, I wish I had been born sooner, I wish I had lived with you more first! We had such good times!"[PARAGRAPH:1]Gallun felt his eyes go moist and hugged her again, pressing her to him.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Oh, father, when he looked at me... Is that how the Lady feels all the time? Father," she whispered in his ear, "I wish I'd lived longer. I wish I had more life to give him. I wish I had more happiness to offer up for him. Father, I just I wish I could die twice!"
TEXT.French: "Est-elle arrivée ?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Non, Gallun, pas encore... N'as-tu rien d'autre à dire à ta femme ?"[PARAGRAPH:1]Gallun observa Caracylna. Elle était facilement bien plus belle que le jour de leur rencontre, il y a bien longtemps et dans un autre Âge. Il était alors un soldat et elle la fille d'un noble enlevée par des maraudeurs. Il l'avait délivrée, et gagné sa main en... Gallun laissa le souvenir filer. Il n'était même pas sûr de savoir si c'était un rêve ou la réalité. C'était il y a si longtemps, et de plus de l'autre côté de la mort. Les Prêtres affirmaient que de telles pensées, si elles n'étaient pas réelles, étaient un présage de grandes choses à venir. Peut-être. Gallun s'arracha à ses souvenirs pour revenir au présent.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Non, Caraclyna, rien de plus. Comment va, comment s'appelle-t-il... Ferrauth ?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Il va bien. Caralun ne l'a jamais apprécié, odnc il s'est absenté. Un course à la rivière."[PARAGRAPH:1]La conversation s'éteignit là, comme tout ce qu'ils ont fait ces 100 dernières années. Ils s'étaient amusés ensemble, pensait Gallun, des deux côtés du Don. Les Scions ne disent plus "rien ne dure éternellement," car c'est un blasphème. Mais tout n'a pas duré éternellement.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ils attendirent leur fille dans le silence qui les accompagne.[PARAGRAPH:1]Quand Caralun arriva dans la rue, elle fut précédée par un silence soudain, puis un chuchotement excité, puis un autre silence... mais pas de la même nature. Un de ceux qui cachent plus de chochotements.[PARAGRAPH:1]Caralun tourna au coin et le silence s'engouffra dans la rue de Caraclyna à mesure que chacun s'arrêtait pour observer. C'était Dame Korinna ! Puis l'excitation. Ou... attendez. Non, ce n'était pas Korinna.[PARAGRAPH:1]Caralun était habillée tout de noir, les cheveux teints de la même couleur et une lame dégainée à la main. L'Atelier avait modifié son crâne et son visage pour ressembler à la Protectrice. Mais c'était le voisinage de Caralun. Et ils remarquaient les yeux, la taille. Ce n'était pas Korinna, mais quelqu'un dévoué à l'exemple de la grande Dame. Quelqu'un prêt à tout donner pour l'Empereur. Un Martyr. Au début, on aurait dit que Dame korinna leur rendait visite. La DAme marchait maintenant souvent dans les rues de la capitale, transmettant sa sagesse, ses dons, mais plus que tout sa présence. Une visite de la Dame laissait présager chance et succès. Joie et sécurité.[PARAGRAPH:1]Mais un Martyr laissait présager autre chose. Totalement autre chose. La mort était absente de la ville, mais les Martyrs de Patria sortaient la chercher. Certains revenaient, souvent en morceaux, et devenaient des conteneurs arcaniques. Mais pas la plupart, et ils reteront ainsi jusqu'à la fin de l'Âge. La prochaine fois qu'ils reverraient leur fille, ni Gallun ni Caracylna ne pourraient se souvenir d'elle. Caracylna but de l'Emmerlane, afin d'aider ses larmes de joie à venir, et enlaça sa fille.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Tu as l'air d'aller bien ! Tu as l'air radieuse, la Dame n'a rien à t'envier ! Je suis fière, je te le dis, je suis fière !"[PARAGRAPH:1]Gallun fit de son mieux pour sourire. Il enlaça sa fille, "Caralun, ma Caralun."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Père, dis moi aussi que tu es fier."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Bien sûr que je suis fier !"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Je savais que tu le serais ! Dame Korinna m'a donnée cette épée ! L'Empereur l'a bénie ! N'est-ce pas merveilleux ? J'ai su dès que je L'ai vu que ce serait la meilleure chose que je pourrais faire, le mieux que je pourrais être !"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Oui, ma fille..."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Mais, père, oh comme j'aurais aimé naître plus tôt, j'aurais aimé vivre avec vous plus longtemps ! On a passé tellement de bons moments ensemble !"[PARAGRAPH:1]Gallun sentit ses yeux devenir humides et la serra à nouveau, la serrant conter lui.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Oh père, quand Il m'a regardée... est-ce ce que la Dame ressent tout le temps ? Père," elle lui chuchota à l'oreille, "j'aurais aimé vivre plus longtemps. J'aurais aimé pouvoir lui donner plus de vie. J'aurais aimé avoir plus de bonheur à lui offrir. Père, j'aurais juste aimé pouvoir mourir deux fois !"

TEXT.English: Fanatics who worship the Risen Emperor as their personal god and view Korinna as their patron saint. They exist only to carry their own deaths to the Emperor's enemies.[PARAGRAPH:1]With "Poisons" each Martyr undergoes treatments permeating her flesh and blood with powerful, corrosive poisons. Normal life becomes impossible, but an extraordinary death easy.[PARAGRAPH:1]Martyrs find destruction in even sucessfull combats half the time. Except those against Worker-types and Birds, who are not worthy.[PARAGRAPH:1]Surviving Martyrs may eventually become Emperor's Daggers.
TEXT.French: Ce sont des fanatiques qui vénèrent l'Empereur Ressuscité comme leur dieu personnel et voient en Korinna leur sainte patronne. Ils n'existent que pour porter leur propre mort aux ennemis de l'Empereur.[PARAGRAPH:1]à l'aide de "Poisons" chaque Martyr subit des traitements imbibant sa chair et son sang de poisons puissants et corrosifs. Une vie normale devient impossible, mais une mort extraordinaire très facile.[PARAGRAPH:1]Même en cas de combat victoirieux, les Martyrs meurent une fois sur deux, à l'exception de ceux menés contre des ouvriers ou des Oiseaux, et qui n'en valent pas la peine.[PARAGRAPH:1]Les Martyrs qui survivent peuvent devenir des Lames de l'Empereur.

TEXT.English: Melante, the Artful Governor. Melante is the head of the Dark Council.[PARAGRAPH:1]She knows it is better to rule through fear than love, but sees no difficulty in using both.
TEXT.French: Melante, la Gouverneur Ingénieuse. Melante est la tête du Conseil Noir.[PARAGRAPH:1]Elle sait qu'il est mieux de régner par la peur que par l'amour, mais n' aucune difficulté à utiliser les deux.

TEXT.English: Necromancers have learned the trick of drawing on the death of their foes for strength. So, armed with swords rather than wands, they seek strength.[PARAGRAPH:1]After each victory Necromancers temporarily enjoy increased strength and access to the spell "Balefire."

TEXT.English: Warrior-Priests of the Emperor's Cult. They guard important cities or Scion leaders. The elaborate "White Steel" silk and ivory composite armor is just as expensive to obtain as it is to enchant.
TEXT.French: Prêtres-Guerriers du Culte de l'Empereur, ils protègent les villes importantes ou les dirigeants scions. Leur armure composite de soie et d'ivoire en "Acier Blanc" est tout aussi chère à obtenir qu'à enchanter.

TEXT.English: A wall of iron and death standing between Patria Reborn and the barbarian peoples.[PARAGRAPH:1]Principes require the best of everything - prizing especially fine clothes and bejeweled weapons, armor, and other accouterments.
TEXT.French: Un mur de fer et de mort s'interposant entre Patria Ressuscitée et les peuples barbares.[PARAGRAPH:1]Un Principe requiert ce qui ce fait de mieux, prisant particulièrement les beaux atours et les armes et armures ornées de joyaux, ou autres accoutrements du même acabit.

TEXT.English: The Cathedral of Rebirth celebrates the glory of both the Emperor and the people. Cathedrals tie the empire together with self-veneration. It is in the Cathedrals that the chosen of the new age's people are ceremoniously made into true Scions of Patria.[PARAGRAPH:1]Preaching of the Risen Emperor and his Gift is all the more powerful when his own people embrace his divinity. Open Borders make it easier to recruit Reborn. Bonus hammers are awarded if you have an Open Border. More Open Borders mean more hammers: Up to +25. The "God King" civic is inspiring: Using it counts as another Open Border.
TEXT.French: La [LINK=LORE_BRIGHT_LAND_4]Cathédrale de la Renaissance[\LINK] célèbre la gloire de l'Empereur et du peuple. Les Cathédrales lient l'empire dans une auto-vénération. C'est au sein des Cathédrales que les élus parmis les nouvelles gens sont reconnues cérémonieusement comme de vrais Scions de Patria.[PRAGRAPH:1]Prêcher pour l'Empereur Ressuscité et son Don est d'autant plus puissant si son peuple le choisit comme divinité. Un accord de Libre Passage facilite le recrutement de Ressuscités. Des marteaux bonus sont donnés si vous avez un accord de Libre Passage. Plus d'accords de Libre Passage signifie plus de marteaux, jusqu'à 25. La doctrine [LINK=CIVIC_GOD_KING]Monarchie de droit divin[\LINK] est source d'inspiration : l'adopter compte comme un autre accord de Libre Passage.

TEXT.English: Priests not of the Patrian church but of the Gift itself. The Redactors do not worship death. Rather, they worship the secret merger of being and void animating the Scions.[PARAGRAPH:1]They whisper this secret to the winds, and the winds bow. Where the winds bow the land changes. Animals become scarce and strange, the trees lay down their arms. In the earth a thousand eyes open wide, and from the sky a thousand mouths open and whisper back the secret.
TEXT.French: Ce sont les prêtres, non de l'église Patricienne mais du Don lui-même. Les Scribes ne vénèrent pas la mort elle-même. Au lieu de ça, ils vénèrent le lien secret entre l'être et le vide qui anime les scions.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ils chuchotent ce secret aux vents, et les vents se soumettent. Là où les vents se soumettent les terres changent. Les animaux se raréfient et deviennent étranges, les arbres rendent les armes. Dans la terre, un millier d'yeux s'ouvrent grand, et depuis les cieux un millier des bouches s'ouvrent et chuchotent le secret en retour.

TEXT.English: The Haunted Lands are not well suited to the living. Use them to defend Patria Reborn or spoil the territories of your enemies. The Haunted Lands are also a source of many wonders... often grotesque or terrible. The useful ones can be kept or traded so others may appreciate the Gift.
TEXT.French: Les Terres Hantées ne sont pas adaptées aux vivants. Utilisez les pour défendre Patria ressuscitée ou dégrader les territoires de vos ennemis. Les Terres Hantées sont également source de nombreuses merveilles... souvent grotesques ou terribles. Les utiles peuvent être gardées ou marchandées, pour que d'autres puissent également apprécier le Don.
TEXT.German: Die Heimgesuchten Lande sind kein geeigneter Aufenthaltsort für die Lebenden. Benutzt sie, um das Wiedergeborenen Patria zu verteidigen und das Gebiet Eurer Feinde zu verheeren. Die Heimgesuchten Lande sind außerdem eine Heimstatt für viele Wunder... oftmals grotesker oder schrecklicher Natur. Die Brauchbaren mögen behalten werden oder gehandelt, so dass andere in den Genuss des Geschenks kommen.
TEXT.Italian: The Haunted Lands are not well suited to the living. Use them to defend Patria Reborn or spoil the territories of your enemies. The Haunted Lands are also a source of many wonders... often grotesque or terrible. The useful ones can be kept or traded so others may appreciate the Gift.

TEXT.English: Bone and magic woven together with the most powerful weirds laid by priests of the national cult. Those killed near them are doomed to rise and fight for the Scions of Patria.
TEXT.French: Des os et de la magie tissés ensemble avec les bizarreries les plus puissantes à disposition des prêtres du culte national. Ceux qui meurent à leurs côtés sont forcés de se relever et de se battre pour les scions de Patria.

TEXT.English: [PARAGRAPH:1]"We made our lines just outside the Hawkwood. I was on the hill nearest the road. So I had a good view when they appeared. At first you could just see the sunlight coming off the spearheads and armor. Shiny bastards. I saw the Captain grab his horn, waiting for the Prince's. The plan was to hit them when half of the army was outside the forest. So the signal didn't come. More and more came out from the trees. We'd hoped the Margrave's men would have tied them up, made them leave most their force at the river. A murmur went down the line and the whole thing shifted back a pace when we saw there were three columns marching from the 'wood. The Captain said something and held us, I don't remember what.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Maybe we should have hit them then, but the Prince's horn still didn't blow. Maybe he'd seen what I'd just noticed... One of the columns was wearing our uniforms. Some wore tattered, bloody rags. Some looked like they were on parade. I saw one that looked practically torn to shreds. No one spoke, but the line shuddered. I think it almost broke. The Captain said something again but I wasn't listening. It wasn't just metal that gleamed, but bone. They were dead. All of them, I think, but some of them were smiling anyway. The kind of smile we'll all make in our graves, you know what I mean? I saw that much before *he* came.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]A tall man in gold armor on a tall black horse, and the whole hill tilted away under me when he rode into the sunlight. The Scion army stopped, and so did we - everybody just froze in place. The Captain was praying, I could hear, but other than that it was silent. It must have been a trick of the light, or my eyes, but everything seemed to narrow down or funnel around the man on the horse. The Risen Emperor. Then his hand rose up, and the Scion army came to ready. By the time it came down I was already running.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]You wanted my tale, and now you have it. You'll get no good word from the Hawkwood. No other word at all. And that's why I'm here, my friend, and why I'm drinking up the last of your wine before it's too late."

TEXT.English: Themoch is the Silent Watcher. Themoch is first member of the Dark Council.[NEWLINE]He sees all without being seen, hears all without being heard.[NEWLINE]Knows all without being known. He is the one you need to cast the world spell.
TEXT.French: Themoch est le Veilleur Silencieux. Themoch est le premier membre du Conseil Noir.[NEWLINE]Il voit tout sans être vu, entend tout sans être entendu.[NEWLINE]Connait tout sans être connu. Il est celui dont vous avez besoin pour lancer le sort mondial.

TEXT.English: Heavily armed compared to most scouts, Velites are slower but have more bite. Relatively slow, but as skirmishers they'll shield front-line units from interference while often withdrawing from danger.
TEXT.French: Lourdement armés par rapport à la plupart des éclaireurs, les Vélites sont plus lents mais plus mordants. Relativement lents, en tant qu'escarmoucheurs ils protègeront les unités de première ligne tout en se repliant souvent face au danger.

TEXT.English: Getton, Captain-Priest of the Veil, held a scented cloth to his nose with one hand and raised a whip in the other. "Stop them, fool, or you'll join them."[PARAGRAPH:1]The mage cringed away from the whip and cried, "But, my lord, they won't heed! We..." In the middle distance Diseased Corpses could be seen climbing clumsily over the fortifications and toward the surrounding woods. [NEWLINE]Snarling curses Getton brought down the whip, again and again.[PARAGRAPH:1]The mage turned out to be a screamer. The Captain-Priest had stuffed his perfumed handkerchief into the man's mouth and, boot on face, was kicking the mewling wreck when a figure appeared in the doorway.[PARAGRAPH:1]Without looking up Getton said, "This one's useless, put him with the prisoners for the ceremony. Tell the assistant corpse-wrangler the good news, and that he'll be part of the midnight festivities too if he doesn't get his charges back in place.[PARAGRAPH:1]"No."[PARAGRAPH:1]"What!?" Getton looked up, ready to kill, and found he was too late. Black leather robe already spattered with bright red blood, a band of the same shade hiding his eyes, the Scion Necromancer stepped forward and silently passed his sword through Getton's neck.
TEXT.French: Getton, Prêtre-Capitaine du Voile, approcha de son nez un vêtement parfumé avec une main et leva un fouet de l'autre. "Arrête les, pauvre fou, ou tu les rejoindras."[PARAGRAPH:1]Le mage se recroquevilla loin du fouet et cria, "Mais, mon seigneur, ils ne m'écouteront pas ! Nous..." Un peu plus loin, on pouvait voir des Cadavres Infectés grimper maladroitement aux fortifications et dans les bois environnants.[PARAGRAPH:1]Grondant des imprécations, Getton abattit le fouet, encore et encore.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le mage devint criard. Le Prêtre-Capitaine enfonça son foulard parfumé dans la bouche de l'homme et, botte sur le visage, frappait cette épave geignarde quand un visage apparut dans l'embrasure de la porte.[PARAGRAPH:1]Sans lever les yeux, Getton dit, "Celui-là est inutile, emmenez-le avec les prisonniers pour la cérémonie. Faites part à l'assistant embaumeur de la bonne nouvelle, et qu'il fera également partie des festivités de minuit s'il ne remet pas en place ses affaires."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Non."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Quoi ?!?" Getton leva les yeux, prêt à tuer, et vit qu'il avait été trop lent. Une robe de cuir noir déjà maculée de sang rouge brillant, une bande de la même ombre cachant ses yeux, le Nécromancien scion s'avança et silencieusement transperça avec sa lame au travers de la nuque de Getton.

TEXT.English: Honor to the Archon! The Doomgiver takes the title "Archon" and governorship over a city and surrounding countryside. The lines of destiny twist with his will, at his whim. With Chance the priesthood's mistress efficiency increases, the city sparkles, and dissenters tend to meet unfortunate accidents. The benefits of accepting Patria Reborn become very clear, the penalties for rejecting her very imminent.
TEXT.French: Gloire à l'Archon ! L'Exécuteur prend le titre d'"Archon" et le rôle de gouverneur d'une ville et de ses environs. Les fils du destin se mouvent selon sa volonté, selon ses caprices. Grâce à la Chance, l'efficacité de la grande prêtresse augmente, la ville prospère, et les fauteurs de troubles ont tendance à être victimes de malheureux accidents. Les avantages à accepter Patria Ressuscitée deviennent très clairs, et les risques à la rejeter très concrets.

TEXT.English: Available to Redactors and, with Necromancy, Ghostwalkers. The Redactor version has an area of 1.[PARAGRAPH:1]It is the nature of the world that everything is itself. This may seem a truism, but it does not hold true in the Haunted Lands. The Haunted Lands join everything together, in the Haunted Lands things *blur*. Notibly the line between death and life. There life, of a sort, is found in death and death, of a sort, is found in life.[PARAGRAPH:1]Eating anything grown within the Haunted Lands is very difficult. The grain may scream when harvested and make bread that crumbles into something like bone meal when baked. Its beer could taste and smell of nightmares. Cattle tend to be stillborn, which makes it all the more disturbing as the herds continue to grow.[PARAGRAPH:1]Nevertheless there is much wealth to be found in the Haunted Lands for the brave of heart and strong of stomach. Examples: A tree with branches that, when dropped, aged, and dried, taste of nectar and honey after being killed and cooked. A stream lined with trainable, watchful stones. A pit full of knowledgeable darkness.
TEXT.French: Disponible pour les [LINK=UNIT_REDACTOR]Scribes[\LINK] et, après avoir découvert la [LINK=TECH_NECROMANCY]Nécromancie[\LINK], pour les [LINK=UNIT_GHOSTWALKER]Marcheurs Fantomatiques[\LINK]. La version des Scribes a une portée de 1.[PARAGRAPH:1]C'est la nature du monde que chaque chose soit elle-même. Ça peut avoir l'air d'un truisme, mais cette vérité est mise en défaut dans les Terres Hantées. Ces dernières rassemblent tout, et les choses s'y 'troublent'. Particulièrement la frontière entre la vie et la mort. Là-bas, la vie est d'une certaine manière trouvée dans la mort, et la mort est d'une certaine manière trouvée dans la vie.[PARAGRAPH:1]Manger quoi que ce soit ayant poussé dans les Terres Hantées est très difficile. Le grain pourrait crier lors de la récolte et faire du pain qui s'effrite en quelque chose à l'air de farine d'os une fois cuit. Sa bière pourrait avoir le goût et l'odeur de cauchemars. Le bétail tend à être mort-né, ce qui est de plus en plus dérangeant à mesure que le troupeau continue de grossir.[PARAGRAPH:1]Néanmoins, de nombreux trésors y attendent le courageux au cœur et à l'estomac solides. Par exemple, un arbre dont les branches, quand elles sont vieilles et sèches et qu'elles tombent ont le goût de miel et de nectar une fois tuées et cuisinées. Un ruisseau bordé par des pierres vigilantes et entraînables. Une fosse remplie de ténèbres pleines d'enseignements.

TEXT.English: "You know we cannot afford a war with the elves."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Of course, dear lady, you've made that abundantly clear."[PARAGRAPH:1]"And yet you persist in drawing them to us. I know you enjoy taunting their Queen, but know also you risk the Emperor's good will."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Yet again, "Of course, dear lady." Did I not mention I have a cunning plan?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"I find that strangely comfortless."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Our silent friend here... his little friends move through the western forests as we speak. When they reach the plains there will be a sudden plague in the fields, in the orchards, and in the pastures..."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Ah. I'll have a mission of aid prepared. There will be famine and sickness among the elves, and where they they walk so does death. And where death walks..."[PARAGRAPH:1]"... so does salvation. I go not to make war on the elves, but to save them!"
TEXT.French: "Vous savez que nous ne pouvons pas nous permettre une guerre avec les elfes."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Bien sûr, douce dame, vous avez été particulièrement claire sur ce point."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Et pourtant vous continuez de les attirer à nous. Je sais que vous aimez provoquer leur Reine, mais sais aussi que vous risquez de perdre les faveurs de l'Empereur."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Encore une fois, 'bien sûr, douce dame.' Ne vous ai-je pas dit que j'avais un plan rusé ?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Je trouve ça étrangement inconfortable."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Notre ami silencieux ici présent... ses jeunes amis traversent les forêts de l'ouest à l'heure où nous parlons. Quand ils atteindront les plaines, une soudaine épidémie apparaîtra dans les champs, dans les vergers, et dans les pâtures..."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Ah. Je ferai préparer une mission de secours. Les elfes seront victimes de la famine et la maladie, et là où ils iront les suivra la mort. Et là où marche la mort..."[PARAGRAPH:1]"... marche également la rédemption. Je ne vais pas déclencher une guerre avec les elfes, mais les sauver !"

TEXT.English: Doomsayers bend fate. Only in minor ways outside their temples... But there are so many things that might go wrong, so many ways to die.[PARAGRAPH:1]Cast by both Doomsayers and Doomgivers, Deadly Mishaps can sometimes befall those afflicted.
TEXT.French: Les Prophètes de la Damnation jouent avec le destin. De manière subtile hors de leurs temples... Mais il y a tellement de choses qui peuvent mal tourner, tellement de manières de mourir.[PARAGRAPH:1]Peut être lancé à la fois par les Prophètes de la Damnation et le Exécuteurs de la Damnation, et la victime peut parfois attirer le Mauvais Oeil Mortel.

TEXT.English: [PARAGRAPH:1]Why's it called "Reaching Creeper, Sarge?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Did you see it when we went to sleep in it?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Ha, no Sarge! Wouldn't have sat on it if I had! When that Hunter came along and told us... Jump!? I nearly started!"[PARAGRAPH:1]"That's part of why it's called Creeper."[PARAGRAPH:1]"What about Reaching?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"They say it's still part of the big undead forest. It's more like a finger or a tentacle sorta *reaching* out to us than a real plant."[PARAGRAPH:1]"That's creepy, Sage."[PARAGRAPH:1]"And that's the other part of why it's called Creeper."
TEXT.French: [TAB]"Pourquoi on l'appelle 'Ronce Insidieuse', Sarge ?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"L'avais-tu vue quand nous nous sommes couchés dessus ?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Ah non, Sarge ! Si j'avais su, je me serais jamais assis dessus ! Quand ce Chasseur est passé et nous a dit... Sautez ! J'ai failli !"[PARAGRAPH:1]"C'est en partie pourquoi on appelle ça 'Insidieux'."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Et pourquoi 'Ronces' ?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"On dit qu'elles font partie de la grande forêt morte-vivante. C'est un peu comme un doigt ou une tentacule qui pousserait pour nous atteindre, plus qu'une plante réelle."[PARAGRAPH:1]"C'est... vicieux ça, Sarge".[PARAGRAPH:1]"Est c'est aussi pour ça qu'on les appelles 'Insidieuses'."

TEXT.English: Reaching Creepers are motile growths - probably basically plants - created by the Haunted Lands, germinating from spilled Ghostwalker blood, or voluntarily by the Black Lady. At times they seem dead growths, at other times they're a lush green. Usually clearly vegetable, sometimes they seem more like animals. They can certainly eat flesh... Creepers embody the unnatural "life" of the Haunted Lands. All start as Young Creepers with no special abilities. With "Mature Creeper" they can cast "Arawn's Dust." At "Blooming Creeper" they can cast "Burrowing Thorns".
TEXT.French: Les Ronces Insidieuses sont des organismes mobiles, probablement des plantes à la base, créées par les Terres Hantées, issues du sang versé par les Marcheurs Fantomatiques, ou volontairement par la Dame Noire. Parfois elles ressemblent à des plantes mortes, et parfois elles sont d'un vert luxuriant. Généralement clairement assimilées à des plantes, elle ressemblent toutefois parfois à des animaux. Elles peuvent sans aucun doute dévorer de la chair... Les Ronces sont gorgées de la "vie" non-naturelle des Terres Hantées.[PARAGRAPH:1]Toutes commencent comme [LINK=PROMOTION_CREEPER_YOUNG]Jeunes Ronces[\LINK] sans capacité spéciale. En devenant des [LINK=PROMOTION_CREEPER_MATURE]Ronces Adultes[\LINK] elles gagnent la possibilité de lancer le sort [LINK=SPELL_ARAWNS_DUST]Poussière d'Arawn[\LINK]. Enfin, au stade de [LINK=PROMOTION_CREEPER_BLOOMING]Ronces Écloses[\LINK], elles peuvent lancer le sort [LINK=SPELL_BURROWING_THORNS]Burrowing Thorns[\LINK].

TEXT.English: The smell of burning human flesh presages one of the Necromancer's most feared rites: The Death Geas. This horrifying magic ages its victims several decades in a matter of moments, invariably leaving a drawn, skull-like visage. Normally such effects are ephemeral, good only to frighten and, perhaps, cull a few of the oldest targets. But the Death Geas's perverted magic turns the body's own energy against itself.[PARAGRAPH:1]As the afflicted weaken, so does the magic. But when they gain strength so, too, does the magic. The one way to break the curse is to kill.[PARAGRAPH:1]Goaded by pain, or pride, or fear of mortality, some victims cease caring who must die to free them.

TEXT.English: It is the nature of the Haunted Land to join things. Life and death, light and dark, motion and stillness, all blend and blur toward one.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the end everything will be everything, or perhaps everything will be nothing.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ghostwalkers, already close to the edge, just need to step off it. They mix themselves into the Haunted Land, sharing more of it's nature. But they chose what they want to share. They take strength and speed. They share, and give up, a portion of their humanity.[PARAGRAPH:1]Afterwards they step back. Or, sometimes, they don't.

In addition to granting the Gift to units unfortunatly alive the spell transforms Scions' cavalry mounts into ravening, undead beasts.

TEXT.English: Sated with blood, the Creeper may bloom into a Haunted Lands Feature.
TEXT.French: Repue de sang, la Ronce peut désormais fleurir et se transformer en Terre Hantée.
TEXT.German: Gesättigt mit Blut mag der Kriecher in den Heimgesuchten Landen gedeihen..
TEXT.Italian: Sated with blood, the Creeper may bloom into a Haunted Lands Feature.
TEXT.Spanish: Sated with blood, the Creeper may bloom into a Haunted Lands Feature.

TEXT.English: A Reaching Creeper, whatever it's actual nature, is still something like a plant. Given the right conditions - mostly enough blood and death - it can take root and send out runners, flower, fruit or by means both less conventional and more disturbing blossom forth into a Haunted Land forest.

TEXT.English: Saturated with a powerful, corrosive poison, the Martyrs of Patria kill even as they are destroyed.
TEXT.French: Saturated with a powerful, corrosive poison, the Martyrs of Patria kill even as they are destroyed.
TEXT.German: Durchtänkt mit einem mächtigen, ätzenden Gift töten die Märtyrer von Patria sogar noch bei ihrer Vernichtung.
TEXT.Italian: Saturated with a powerful, corrosive poison, the Martyrs of Patria kill even as they are destroyed.
TEXT.Spanish: Saturated with a powerful, corrosive poison, the Martyrs of Patria kill even as they are destroyed.

TEXT.English: A pervasive and somehow tangible feeling of the Emperor's presence.[PARAGRAPH:1]Present in any city Founded by the Risen Emepror.

TEXT.English: By the generosity of the Emperor, the Parliament of Merchants and Citizens exists to give the most upstanding and valuable citizens a voice in governing of the Scions.
TEXT.French: By the generosity of the Emperor, the Parliament of Merchants and Citizens exists to give the most upstanding and valuable citizens a voice in governing of the Scions.
TEXT.German: By the generosity of the Emperor, the Parliament of Merchants and Citizens exists to give the most upstanding and valuable citizens a voice in governing of the Scions.

TEXT.English: Known more often as the "Dark Council," the organization is primarily an instrument for maintaining the wealth and power of Patria Reborn's merchant princes. But the Dark Council is more than an advisory parliament and financial clearing house. It's also a clearing house for a great deal of information about the rich and powerful. Both among the Scions and the other peoples of the Age of Rebirth. Information the Imperial Cult can put to use.

TEXT.English: "Believed to be a smut - an ailment usually attacking grains - the disease known as "Arawn's Dust" can wipe out not only whole crops of grain, but it also attacks other commercial crops such as dyes or incenses. Not just some such crops, but *all* of them. Even more worrying, the disease appears to have spread to cattle as well. Every herd in the Techel province has been reduced to withered husks covered with white or grey dust. The devastation is terrible. Wherever this dust is blown more sickness follows.[PARAGRAPH:1]Arawn's Dust's virulence is too great for any natural disease. So, to answer the Regent's question, the disease is almost certainly a product of magical intervention. We suspect the Sheaim." - Testimony of Alguran Bildoon, Chief Horticulturist

TEXT.French: Destroys a camp, farm, pasture, or plantation.
TEXT.German: Zerstört einen Bauernhof, ein Lager, ein Tiergehege oder eine Plantage.
TEXT.Italian: Destroys a camp, farm, pasture, or plantation.
TEXT.Spanish: Destroys a camp, farm, pasture, or plantation.

TEXT.English: "The gold can hardly be missed. And after all your long years of service don't you deserve it? Yes, I think so too."

TEXT.French: Corrupts the unit's quartermaster, costing the owner gold until he's caught.
TEXT.German: Corrupts the unit's quartermaster, costing the owner gold until he's caught.

TEXT.English: Alcinus creates his keep in one night, apparently summoning it from the ether. In addition to supplying the Scions with mana students of the arcane receive advanced training at the Keep. Unfortunatly the side effects of Alcinus' activities tend to disrupt the city somewhat. You can't please everyone.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Keep's stats vary with the type of mana produced.[PARAGRAPH:1]Rather than a third mana the Keep sometimes gives Alcinus' Trove or the Schola Furo instead.

TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Ne peut pas être lancé dans la capitale.
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Kann nicht in der Hauptstadt gezaubert werden.

TEXT.English: Korrina has broken the palace Wards. At last Unshackled, she marches against our enemies!
TEXT.French: Korrina has broken the palace Wards. At last Unshackled, she marches against our enemies!
TEXT.German: Korrina hat den Palastbezirk verlassen. Endlich ungebunden, kann sie nun gegen unsere Feinde zu Felde ziehen.
TEXT.Italian: Korrina has broken the palace Wards. At last Unshackled, she marches against our enemies!
TEXT.Spanish: Korrina has broken the palace Wards. At last Unshackled, she marches against our enemies!

TEXT.English: The Lady of Knives lives, but has been granted an everlasting existence at the whim of the Risen Emperor. What does that mean? It means blood, it means war, it means death.
TEXT.French: The Lady of Knives lives, but has been granted an everlasting existence at the whim of the Risen Emperor. What does that mean? It means blood, it means war, it means death.
TEXT.German: Die Prinzessin der Messer lebt, jedoch der Lust und Laune des Auferstandenen Imperators auf Gedeih und Verderb ausgeliefert, und doch mit der Aussicht auf ein unsterbliches Dasein. Was das bedeutet? Es bedeutet Blut, es bedeutet Krieg, es bedeutet Tod.
TEXT.Italian: The Lady of Knives lives, but has been granted an everlasting existence at the whim of the Risen Emperor. What does that mean? It means blood, it means war, it means death.
TEXT.Spanish: The Lady of Knives lives, but has been granted an everlasting existence at the whim of the Risen Emperor. What does that mean? It means blood, it means war, it means death.

TEXT.English: Korrina gaze, blanked by a Necromancer's blidfold, pierces the Haunted Land's deepest secrets. The essense of the Lands, the essense of the world, rises in her. And that essense is Death.
TEXT.French: Korrina gaze, blanked by a Necromancer's blidfold, pierces the Haunted Land's deepest secrets. The essense of the Lands, the essense of the world, rises in her. And that essense is Death.
TEXT.German: Korrinas Blick, verborgen hinter der Augenbinde eines Nekromanten, durchdringt die verborgensten Geheimnisse der Heimgesuchten Lande. Die Essenz dieser Lande erhebt sich in ihr. Und diese Essenz ist ... der Tod.
TEXT.Italian: Korrina gaze, blanked by a Necromancer's blidfold, pierces the Haunted Land's deepest secrets. The essense of the Lands, the essense of the world, rises in her. And that essense is Death.
TEXT.Spanish: Korrina gaze, blanked by a Necromancer's blidfold, pierces the Haunted Land's deepest secrets. The essense of the Lands, the essense of the world, rises in her. And that essense is Death.

TEXT.English: Pelemoc Goldtongue has risen to trouble your foes, or friends.
TEXT.French: Pelemoc Goldtongue has risen to trouble your foes, or friends.
TEXT.German: Pelemoc Goldtongue hat sich erhoben, um Euren Feinden Kummer zu machen, oder auch Euren Freunden.
TEXT.Italian: Pelemoc Goldtongue has risen to trouble your foes, or friends.
TEXT.Spanish: Pelemoc Goldtongue has risen to trouble your foes, or friends.

TEXT.English: Themoch, the Silent Watcher, has risen.
TEXT.French: Themoch, the Silent Watcher, has risen.
TEXT.German: Themoch, der Stille Beobachter, ist auferstanden.
TEXT.Italian: Themoch, the Silent Watcher, has risen.
TEXT.Spanish: Themoch, the Silent Watcher, has risen.

TEXT.English: Melante, the Artful Governor, has risen.
TEXT.French: Melante, the Artful Governor, has risen.
TEXT.German: Melante, die Begnadete Verwalterin, ist auferstanden.
TEXT.Italian: Melante, the Artful Governor, has risen.
TEXT.Spanish: Melante, the Artful Governor, has risen.

TEXT.English: Korinna the Protector stands ready, though trapped within the capital. Free her with Knowledge of the Ether.
TEXT.French: Korinna the Protector stands ready, though trapped within the capital. Free her with Knowledge of the Ether.
TEXT.German: Korinna, die Beschützerin, steht bereit, auch wenn sie in der Hauptstadt gefangen bleibt, bis Kenntnis vom Äther erforscht wurde.
TEXT.Italian: Korinna the Protector stands ready, though trapped within the capital. Free her with Knowledge of the Ether.
TEXT.Spanish: Korinna the Protector stands ready, though trapped within the capital. Free her with Knowledge of the Ether.

TEXT.English: Alcinus the Mad, Imperial Thaumaturge, has risen. Let the madman build his Keep, but not near the Palace.
TEXT.French: Alcinus the Mad, Imperial Thaumaturge, has risen. Let the madman build his Keep, but not near the Palace.
TEXT.German: Alcinus the Irre, Thaumaturg des Reiches ist auferstanden. Lasst den Verrückten seinen Burgfried bauen und schickt Adepten zur Ausbildung, aber nicht in der Hauptstadt.
TEXT.Italian: Alcinus the Mad, Imperial Thaumaturge, has risen. Let the madman build his Keep, but not near the Palace.
TEXT.Spanish: Alcinus the Mad, Imperial Thaumaturge, has risen. Let the madman build his Keep, but not near the Palace.

TEXT.English: A few inhabitants of the new age have recognized our generosity and power.
TEXT.French: A few inhabitants of the new age have recognized our generosity and power.
TEXT.German: Auch im Neuen Zeitalters haben einige unsere Generösität und Macht erkannt.
TEXT.Italian: A few inhabitants of the new age have recognized our generosity and power.
TEXT.Spanish: A few inhabitants of the new age have recognized our generosity and power.

TEXT.English: Ophelia leader traits change: she receives the Deathtouched and Emperor's Cult traits.
TEXT.French: Ophelia leader traits change: she receives the Deathtouched and Emperor's Cult traits.
TEXT.German: Ophelia leader traits change: she receives the Deathtouched and Emperor's Cult traits.
TEXT.Italian: Ophelia leader traits change: she receives the Deathtouched and Emperor's Cult traits.
TEXT.Spanish: Ophelia leader traits change: she receives the Deathtouched and Emperor's Cult traits.

TEXT.English: The Lord of Death has found us!
TEXT.French: Le Seigneur de la Mort nous a trouvés !
TEXT.German: Der Herr des Todes hat uns aufgespürt!
TEXT.Italian: The Lord of Death has found us!
TEXT.Spanish: The Lord of Death has found us!

TEXT.English: A grand state celebration will demonstrate the Risen Emperor's power over Death.
TEXT.French: A grand state celebration will demonstrate the Risen Emperor's power over Death.
TEXT.German: Eine große Staatsfeierlichkeit wird die Macht des Auferstandenen Imperators über den Tod demonstrieren.
TEXT.Italian: A grand state celebration will demonstrate the Risen Emperor's power over Death.
TEXT.Spanish: A grand state celebration will demonstrate the Risen Emperor's power over Death.

TEXT.English: The God of Deception is displeased with us! Our top sage has revealed himself an emissary of Esus!
TEXT.French: The God of Deception is displeased with us! Our top sage has revealed himself an emissary of Esus!
TEXT.German: Der Gott der Täuschung ist unzufrieden mit uns! Unser Höchster Weiser hat sich selbst als Abgesandter des Esus enthüllt!
TEXT.Italian: The God of Deception is displeased with us! Our top sage has revealed himself an emissary of Esus!
TEXT.Spanish: The God of Deception is displeased with us! Our top sage has revealed himself an emissary of Esus!

TEXT.English: If given a token of our devotion to Esus perhaps he'll throw our enemies into disorder rather than reward them.
TEXT.French: If given a token of our devotion to Esus perhaps he'll throw our enemies into disorder rather than reward them.
TEXT.German: Wenn er ein Zeichen unserer Zuwendung an Esus erhält, wird er vielleicht unsere Feinde eher ins Chaos stürzen, als sie zu belohnen.
TEXT.Italian: If given a token of our devotion to Esus perhaps he'll throw our enemies into disorder rather than reward them.
TEXT.Spanish: If given a token of our devotion to Esus perhaps he'll throw our enemies into disorder rather than reward them.

TEXT.English: Even in ruins this is a place of great value - more than the degenerate people of this Age understand.
TEXT.French: Even in ruins this is a place of great value - more than the degenerate people of this Age understand.
TEXT.German: Selbst als Ruinen sind diese Orte von großem Wert für uns - von viel größerem, als die degenerierten Völker dieser Zeit verstehen können.
TEXT.Italian: Even in ruins this is a place of great value - more than the degenerate people of this Age understand.
TEXT.Spanish: Even in ruins this is a place of great value - more than the degenerate people of this Age understand.

TEXT.German: Wir sind auf eine Stätte eines Wunders gestoßen!

TEXT.English: Our great lord is pleased. His Angel of Good Intentions has proven as true and faithful as hoped. Once again lead the people of Patria to the destiny they deserve!
TEXT.French: Our great lord is pleased. His Angel of Good Intentions has proven as true and faithful as hoped. Once again lead the people of Patria to the destiny they deserve!
TEXT.German: Unser großer Herr ist zufriedengestellt. Sein guter Engel der Guten Absichten hat sich als genauso wahrhaftig und vertrauenswürdig erwiesen, wie gehofft. Wieder einmal führe Er das Volk von Patria zu ihrem verdienten Schicksal!
TEXT.Italian: Our great lord is pleased. His Angel of Good Intentions has proven as true and faithful as hoped. Once again lead the people of Patria to the destiny they deserve!
TEXT.Spanish: Our great lord is pleased. His Angel of Good Intentions has proven as true and faithful as hoped. Once again lead the people of Patria to the destiny they deserve!

TEXT.English: The Risen Emperor has revealed his true colors.
TEXT.French: The Risen Emperor has revealed his true colors.
TEXT.German: Der Auferstandene Imperator hat seine wahren Farben offenbart.
TEXT.Italian: The Risen Emperor has revealed his true colors.
TEXT.Spanish: The Risen Emperor has revealed his true colors.

TEXT.English: The God you betrayed does not forgive, nor does his great Champion. But that worldly Angel supports your fight against evil.
TEXT.French: The God you betrayed does not forgive, nor does his great Champion. But that worldly Angel supports your fight against evil.
TEXT.German: Der Gott, den Ihr betrogen habt, vergibt nicht, noch tut es sein Champion. Doch der weltliche Engel steht Euch im Kampf gegen das Böse bei.
TEXT.Italian: The God you betrayed does not forgive, nor does his great Champion. But that worldly Angel supports your fight against evil.
TEXT.Spanish: The God you betrayed does not forgive, nor does his great Champion. But that worldly Angel supports your fight against evil.

TEXT.English: The Risen Emperor has revealed his true colors.
TEXT.French: The Risen Emperor has revealed his true colors.
TEXT.German: Der Auferstandene Imperator hat sein wahres Gesicht offenbart.
TEXT.Italian: The Risen Emperor has revealed his true colors.
TEXT.Spanish: The Risen Emperor has revealed his true colors.

TEXT.English: "My dear Melante, I said I cannot destroy the city. I did not say the task impossible. On the contrary, it is well within my capabilities. Themoch reports an army large enough to defeat the Emperor himself, true. I remain undaunted. The city is well stocked and Arthendain himself is present. I remain undaunted. Where war, famine and plague cannot prevail I will bring Fear. I will bring Uncertainty. I will bring Doubt. Open your coffers, Melante, and that city will grind to a halt."[PARAGRAPH:1]Pelemoc spreads dissatisfaction and subversion through the city. It is a slow process, but a cumulative one. Given enough time and gold any city (except those tamed by a Prior) will become too angry and afraid to rule.[PARAGRAPH:1]Hiding subversion on this scale is impossible. Pelemoc's Three Horsemen will worsen the other ruler's attitude with each use.

TEXT.English: The Engineer Corps works 25% faster than normal Workers but don't gain free xps.
TEXT.French: The Engineer Corps works 25% faster than normal Workers but don't gain free xps.
TEXT.German: The Engineer Corps works 25% faster than normal Workers but don't gain free xps.

TEXT.English: The ignorant or malicious say the Scions of Patria coerce obediance. No, they offer salvation. As evidence of this one need only point to the Engineer Corps. Rather than the brutal exiles, executions, or excrutiations practiced by the other civilizations of the Age of Rebirth the Scions allow those who shirk their responsibilities as citizens great freedom working in the Engineer Corps.[PARAGRAPH:1]They work with the good earth digging ditchs, building walls, laying roads. Occasionally they're even privileged with the care of domesticated plants and animals. Far from being forced to take part in the Reborn polity, the Engineer Corps remains immersed in the natural world all day, all night, every day of the year without cease.

TEXT.English: Secret assassination is difficult, expensive work. But a Dagger must work carefully if she wishes to avoid a war... and the Emperor's notice. The Emperor may be pleased to wait, but the Apparatus will not tolerate Alcinus abusing the Emperor's patience.[PARAGRAPH:1]Allows Alcinus to be attacked without a declaration of war. Nothing if not thorough, the Dagger also arranges for return of the pieces to Avitas.
